extendedIngredients.name: bacon
extendedIngredients.original: 4 slices bacon, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: baking potatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 2 medium baking potatoes (about 1 1/2 lbs), peeled and cut into 2-inch chunks
extendedIngredients.originalName: medium baking potatoes (about , peeled and cut into 2-inch chunks

extendedIngredients.name: canned tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 1 can (28 ozs) plum tomatoes in juice

extendedIngredients.name: carrots
extendedIngredients.original: 2 medium carrots, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced crosswise (1 cup)
extendedIngredients.originalName: medium carrots, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced crosswise

extendedIngredients.name: tilapia fillets
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb skinless tilapia fillets, cut into 2-inch chunks
extendedIngredients.originalName: skinless tilapia fillets, cut into 2-inch chunks

title: Manhattan Fish Chowder
summary: Manhattan Fish Chowder is a gluten free, dairy free, and whole 30 main course. One serving contains 318 calories, 22g of protein, and 8g of fat. This recipe serves 6. For $2.85 per serving, this recipe covers 24% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 7 people have made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour. Head to the store and pick up bacon, coarse salt and ground pepper, canned tomatoes, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 76%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are Manhattan Fish Chowder, Manhattan-Style Fish Chowder, and Manhattan Fish Chowder with Roasted Fingerling Potatoes and Bacon Relish.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Mark West Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mark West Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description:
Crisp and clean, this wine features honeydew, stone fruit, and citrus with a subtle, clean, lingering finish.
Try pairing with good old fish and chips, summer salads, and steamed clams by the dozen...or dozens.

instructions: Add potatoes and thyme; reduce heat to simmer. Cook until potatoes are tender, but not falling apart, 15 to 20 minutes.

steps.step: Add potatoes and thyme; reduce heat to simmer. Cook until potatoes are tender, but not falling apart, 15 to 20 minutes.
